etymologies: late 18th century; earliest use found in Alexander Wilson (1766–1813), ornithologist and poet. Representing a Scots pronunciation of ah well

definitions: Used to introduce a remark or statement, now especially so as to express acceptance or resignation of a state of affairs already indicated.

notes.text: Aweel functions as a discourse marker with the same range of roles as well; see the note at "well" for a fuller explanation.
